result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa P Hartfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Provide for DNA and pay all costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or ocurt has approved contact.
Comply with all Children's Court orders.

Successfully complete  Anger Management, and continued programming.
PARENTING CLASSES.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending a review on 12-11-215 at 1:15 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa P Hartfield

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Melissa P Hartfield in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Melissa P Hartfield in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.
Defendant sentenced to serve 12 months in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete  Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
 PARENTING CLASSES.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or ocurt has approved contact.
  Comply with all Children's Court orders.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Provide for DNA and pay all costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon may not carry or possess firearms or body armor and civil rights are suspended until restored.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Court ordered defendant to have no contact with Izola Smith or her sons.   mld

Defendant Melissa P Hartfield in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin
with Sarah Zawach (under the student practice rule).
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-19-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  

Court heard and granted defense motion with no objection by the State, to modify the no contact order to no contact with Izola Smith or her sons.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Melissa P Hartfield in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Melissa P Hartfield in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
This is a co-defendant case with (2015CF1783).  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-3-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

15RM021967  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/25/2015
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the co-actor Izola Smith, and DP (12/16/03).

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Melissa P Hartfield in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Melissa P Hartfield in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defendant entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Commissioner orders the Sheriff's Department to collect DNA from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
